channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s pick for chairman isn’t enough to threaten Fed independence, says Bank of America—especially if Jerome Powell decides to stick around
item.description: "The question then becomes, will Powell leave as a governor?"

item.title: Anthropic considers IPO despite warnings that excess liquidity is blowing a bubble in the markets
item.description: Senior central bank chiefs see excess liquidity in a range of asset markets.

item.title: Mark Manson is launching an AI app to help more people ‘Subtly not Give a F*ck’
item.description: Mark Manson’s 2016 book The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fuck delivered some hard truths and prescient advice to millions of readers seeking answers. No...

item.title: The H-1B Shakeup Is a Wake-up Call About How We Build Teams
item.description: As politics affect the skilled visa program, it’s time to reimagine what the future of global work should look like.

item.title: OpenAI may be close to introducing ads for ChatGPT
item.description: OpenAI appeared to be closer to pulling the trigger on advertising in ChatGPT in recent days, but a growing threat from Google has forced the company ...

item.title: Michael Dell, who’s donating $6.25 billion to ‘Trump Accounts’ for kids, says a childhood savings account changed his life
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Exclusive: Angle Health raises $134 million Series B to grow its AI-driven healthcare benefits offerings
item.description: Angle Health has raised a $134 million Series B, led by Portage, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: Jerome Powell Successor at the Fed Is Likely a Pro-Crypto Economist
item.description: President Trump hinted that Kevin Hassett will take the top job.

item.title: China is building the world’s first nuclear-proof floating island. That’s not good news for the U.S.
item.description: Rare earths’ monopoly . Unrivaled manufacturing supply chains . Free AI models that rival, or surpass , its American counterparts. More research paper...

item.title: Researchers Say a 1970s Computer Revolution Can Predict How AI Will Impact Jobs Today
item.description: Lessons from the past can help us predict the future: in this case, how AI will impact the workplace.

item.title: Generic brands are so fancy now that even rich people want to buy them
item.description: Generic store brand groceries can increasingly be found in the pantries, fridges, and freezers of Americans across all income groups. Once designed to...

item.title: Route 66 is about to turn 100—but you’ve never seen it like this
item.description: Route 66. The name alone evokes nostalgia for a simpler, freer time in American history, when roadies stopped for a hot dog with ketchup, then drove i...

item.title: Michael Jordan Says His Bulls Contract Had a Clause He’s ‘Positive’ No Players Today Have. It’s the Secret to Becoming the Best
item.description: In a recent interview, Michael Jordan speaks about the “love of the game” clause from his playing days, and how that helped shape the player he became...

item.title: How to Pay Your Workers Equitably Without a DEI Mandate
item.description: Open use of now-scorned terms may be off the table in the current political climate, but it’s still possible to prioritize fairness at your company.

item.title: A Chinese ice cream chain, powered by super-cheap cones, now has more outlets than McDonald’s
item.description: Chilled drinks and cool prices are helping Mixue take over the booming sweet treat market.
